intro: Strombosiopsis tetrandra, commonly known as the four-threaded strombosiopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive, aromatic scent. Strombosiopsis tetrandra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
